## normalizeUnionTypes() function

Normalizes union and intersection type ordering in TypeScript declaration files.

Processes the entry point file and all transitively imported declaration files, reordering union (`A | B`<!-- -->) and intersection (`A & B`<!-- -->) type members in stable alphanumeric order to ensure consistent API Extractor reports.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function normalizeUnionTypes(options: NormalizerOptions): NormalizationResult;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

options


</td><td>

[NormalizerOptions](./declaration-file-normalizer.normalizeroptions.md)


</td><td>

Configuration options for normalization


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

[NormalizationResult](./declaration-file-normalizer.normalizationresult.md)

Result object containing processing statistics and any errors encountered

## Remarks

This function does not throw exceptions. All errors are returned in the result object. The function modifies files in-place unless `dryRun: true` is specified.

Despite the function name, this normalizes BOTH union types (`A | B`<!-- -->) and intersection types (`A & B`<!-- -->). The name is historical and may be updated in a future major version.

## Example


```typescript
const result = normalizeUnionTypes({
  entryPoint: './dist/index.d.ts',
  dryRun: false,
  verbose: true,
});

if (result.errors.length > 0) {
  console.error('Normalization failed:', result.errors);
} else {
  console.log(`Normalized ${result.typesNormalized} types in ${result.filesProcessed} files`);
}
```
